etymology.description: 家(家) (jiā, "home") + 乡(鄉) (xiāng, "village") refers to one's place of origin or hometown. Together they form 家乡(家鄉) (jiāxiāng, "hometown"), emphasizing the idea of a home village or the place where one feels a deep connection due to personal roots or heritage.
etymology.interpretation: 家乡(家鄉) (jiāxiāng, "hometown") signifies the place that is culturally and sentimentally significant to an individual, often where they were born and raised.
etymology.simplification: 家乡 is the simplified form of 家鄉.

examples.chinese: 每当春节到来时(每當春節到來時)，我都会想念家乡(家鄉)。
examples.pinyin: Měi dāng chūnjié dào lái shí, wǒ dōu huì xiǎngniàn jiāxiāng.
examples.english: Whenever the Spring Festival arrives, I always miss my hometown.

examples.chinese: 经历长途跋涉后(經歷長途跋涉後)，我终于回到了家乡(家鄉)。
examples.pinyin: Jīnglì chángtú báshè hòu, wǒ zhōngyú huí dào le jiāxiāng.
examples.english: After a long journey, I finally returned to my hometown.
